marklogic.body: this was a very lovely series, but my Burning question is, why do most of the korean series end up negative, is it a crime to have a positive ending in your series, the world is harsh, but there is a bright side to life, i have watched quite a lot of korean drama series and the comments and complains from most people is that it mostly ends up sad and that is becoming distatsefull to a lot of viewers. is there a way this particular drama can end better, its so sad that the younger son of the president lost everything and everyone around him, hey please tell the writers to be more cheerfull, when people watch dramas it is to escape the wrong side of the world for some , but if the dramas end up giving concern than , then that is not to appealing. please tell the producers and the writers either to have a sequel to this drama series or add another episode with a happy ending. yes life is sad, but there is Always a BRIGHT BLUE SKY, BEHIND THE NIMBUS CLOUDY SKY.
